numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The X-axis is for the responses of people who are 40 years old or older.
2. The Y-axis is for the responses of people who are 15 years old to 24 years old.
3. The data comes from a survey in 2021.
5. Indonesia has the highest score on this graph.
6. Mali has the lowest score on this graph.
7. In the US, a larger percentage of people who are 15 years old to 24 years old think that the world is getting better than people who are 40 years old or older.
8. People who are 25 years old to 39 years old are not included on the graph.
9. I wonder why people who are 25 years old to 39 years old are not included on the graph.
10. The graph shows the difference in opinion between age groups.
11. I wonder why the graph shows the difference in opinion between age groups.
12. I wonder why the graph does not show the overall percent by country.
13. The US was included in this survey.
14. This survey relates to me and my community.
15. I am not surprised that a larger percent of young people have a more positive outlook than people who are 40 years old or older.
16. The headline is: Are young people more optimistic about the world?
